H0.text: Finding shelter is what an octopus most likely achieves when it releases black ink into the water while feeling threatened.

H1.text: Hunt for food is the most likely outcome when an octopus releases black ink into the water upon feeling threatened.

H2.text: Swim faster is what an octopus most likely does when it releases black ink into the water as a defensive response to a threat.

H3.text: Escaping enemies is most likely helped by an octopus releasing black ink into the water when feeling threatened.

A4.text: Octopus try to escape from a predator by ejecting an ink cloud, which acts as a 'smoke-screen' or a decoy, as well as to interfere with the attacker's sense of smell.
